intro: Dimorphotheca spectabilis, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in open grasslands and has silver-green foliage with a hairy texture. Dimorphotheca spectabilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to full sun and well-drained soils.
